description: Higgs' primes: a(n+1) = next prime such that a(n+1)-1 | (a(1)...a(n))^3.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
mathematica: NextPrime[ n_Integer ] := Module[ {k = n + 1}, While[ ! PrimeQ[ k ], k++ ]; Return[ k ] ]; f[ n_List ] := (a = n; b = Apply[ Times, a^3 ]; d = NextPrime[ a[[ -1 ]] ]; While[ ! IntegerQ[ b/(d - 1) ] && d < b+2, d = NextPrime[ d ] ]; AppendTo[ a, d ]; Return[ a ]); Nest[ f, {2}, 75 ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 25 2000
